title: Coleen Rooney and Rebekah Vardy sparks Footballers' Wives reboot
text:
The public is crying out for a Footballers’ Wives reboot (Picture: Rex; ITV)

Iconic British drama Footballers’ Wives may be returning to our screens after the Coleen Rooney and Rebekah Vardy feud sparked the public’s hunger for a reboot.

A former writer on the show told BBC Radio 4 today she has been inspired to begin talks of reviving the series after Wagatha Christie herself broke the internet two days ago.

Vardy has vehemently denied claims that she was responsible for selling fake stories posted on Rooney’s private Instagram account.

Tanya and Amber’s return would be an iconic moment for British television (Picture: ITV)

The scandal seemed like a storyline from the ITV drama brought to life, so now calls for the series to be revived have reached fever pitch.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘I’m typing as we speak!’ Liz Lake squealed. ‘Wouldn’t [a reboot] be nice?’

Footballers’ Wives ran from 2002-2006 and charted the spectacular highs and lows of WAG culture.

Can you imagine what the characters would get up to in the present day? (Picture: ITV)

Fronted by Zoe Lucker’s insatiable Tanya Turner, the show saw some truly wild times televised to the nation; everything from extra marital and same sex affairs, death by champagne bottle, even a problematic baby swap involving a lot of fake tan.

Social media users have already clocked the similarities between real life and fiction here, and have pretty much been demanding the comedy-drama return to screens immediately.

In light of #coleenvsrebekah, can we please, PLEASE give this nation what it deserves and get a rerun of all Footballers' Wives episodes back on TV? pic.twitter.com/OlvSedJ3Tj — Helen Coffey (@LenniCoffey) October 10, 2019

This Coleen Rooney/Rebekah Vardy malarkey is pulled straight out of Footballers Wives! Further proof we need it to be brought back! Tanya Turner and Amber did all this back in 2005! pic.twitter.com/x77zmlnXBu — Shirley Carter’s Pussy (@ShirleyPussy) October 9, 2019

Somewhere in the ITV offices, an ambitious young producer is frantically typing up their pitch to reboot Footballers' Wives — Jonn Elledge (@JonnElledge) October 9, 2019

Everyone in Britain seemed to collectively lose their minds on Wednesday (has it really only been two days?) since Coleen posted an expose revealing the identity of the person allegedly responsible for selling fake stories to the tabloid press.

‘It’s……….Rebekah Vardy’s account’ will now go down in history.

We’ve already decided on our dream cast – from Jodie Comer to Lea Michele – if Ryan Murphy ever decides to make a TV adaption happen.
